intro: Scabiosa hololeuca, commonly known as the white scabious, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often hairy, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Scabiosa hololeuca is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
